It brought a tear to my eye, and Jim Carey did a great job - I would not have recognized his voice at all and his interpration of Scrooge's personality and character was well done.

I don't know how disney could screw p a christmas carol!  All they had to do was copy it, they left out key ingredients to bore us with flying characters & buildings.  I guess they thought people would be to busy in the theaters going wow to the 3-D, and forget they sacrificed story lines.  One glaring example was when the ghost of christmas past was showing him his past, they left out the death of Scrooge's sister & how he screwed over Mr. Fezziwig (hope I spelled it correctly).  All that happened in his past was he was left at school over christmas & his fiance' dumped him.  There are better christmas carols out there.  Skip this one!
This movie was the best viewed on my home 3D system I have others and they are not as good as this one I was very impressed.
Love this movie. Excellent 3D effects and animation is exceptional.

This video should be used by all film students as a lesson in compositon.  Every frame, whether at the beginning of a scene or at the end, shows perfect compositon.  Every camera move is necessary and results in revealing something that was not known at the beginning of the scene.  Not since "The Third Man" has there been such an excellent teaching tool.  But, beyond the technical aspects, it is just a great movie that all ages can appreciate without analysis.
I had not seen this movie until I rented it. It was great! If you liked the Polar Express, this is made much like it. It is now one of my favorite Christmas movies.
My husband loves A Christmas Carol and watches every version he can find. He was very pleasantly surprised by this one!

When I first heard about this movie I really thought it was going to be a true Disney Children's movie. I was amazed and maybe even a little disappointed that I would not be able to share this movie with my grand children. That being said it definitely not a children's movie but it was a wonderful mature version of a classic. While another review , who claims to be a " Christmas Story " aficionado really cuts the movie as a one star movie. They themselves even admit that the dialog is inline with the writing in the book. But I myself loved the visual adaptation and enjoyed the introduction of new visual aspects of the movie. I did not see the 3d version of the movie, I'm not really into the 3d yet, but I can see how a lot of what was added to the movie would have been awesome in 3d. All that said I thought Jim Carrey was amazing in portraying all the different characters that he did. And if you take the time to view the extras on the DVD you may actually come to appreciate more just how  Robert Zemeckis (Director) did an amazing adaptation of this story. Bottom line..... not a small child's movie but a wonderful rendition of a classic for the adults.

Thanks Mr Zemeckis

This is a new tradition in my family. I applaud Disney for staying true to the story & not being afraid to include the references to God (and in one instance, specifically to Jesus - the One Who makes the lame walk,  paraphrase). The animation is stellar, the voicing is fantastic, and the orchestration is the epitomy of traditional Christmas (carols about Christ's birth, etc). Andrea Bocelli's song "God Bless Us, Everyone" is new and exhilerating. Although this movie is mostly drama, comedy sprinkled throughout keeps it light-hearted where it needs to be.
 Some of the scenes may scare small children (they startled me as an adult!); however, if parents watch first, they can fast forward or have little ones close their eyes until those brief parts are over. I highly recommend this movie to everyone!

I bought this movie for my 2 boys for Xmas thinking it was going to be nice for them to watch a Xmas movie but I was very dissappointed with this movie. The special effects are wonderful as in most movies but my children did not like this movie at all. They are 7 and 8 years old and they felt it was very scary and could not understand well the movie.

I had to explain to them the movie since the movie is about Scrooge's past life. They couldn't get it why he was old first and then he was a little boy and what was going on. The ghost part was the part they did not like at all but I guess that depends on each child. Some children probably wouldn't get scared with ghosts but mine did.

If your child is ok about ghosts, I do recommend it but I think it is a little difficult for children to understand. There is not much adventure in the movie. My children liked much more "The Polar Express" than this one.

Need a little Christmas Spirit? You can't go wrong with this video of "A ChristmasCarol" starring the funniest Scrooge everfimed -- Jim Carrey. I even think Charles Dickens would approve. Gather up your family and enjoy this film.
Wonderful animation of the classic Dicken's story.  Jim Carey is just about the best Scrooge ever.  Glorious in Blu-ray and at times breath taking scenery.  A must see for the whole family.

Bought this as "Used - Like New".  Not a scratch on it.  Great condition. Would buy from again. One thing to note about this movie is that it really is for teens and up.  Some of the ghosts are kind of scary to the kids.  You need to view it before the kids see it.

This movie is so entertaining to watch, not only for the story line, but to see all of the affects that went in to making this movie! Definitely one of my holiday favorites that my family & I will be watching over & over! Enjoyment and captivation for all ages, from my daughter's 5 year old step son to my 61 year old mom! Enjoy!
This wasn't what I'd expect but it was still a fun movie. The 3D was bad for me but I think it is because of my eyes.

Disney's A Christmas Carol (Four-Disc Combo: Blu-ray 3D / Blu-ray / DVD / Digital Copy) Product has good packging. As for movie, it is very good 3D effects, additionally 3 discs included (excluding 3D blu-ray disc). I am satisfied greatly.

I'm typically not a Jim Carrey fan but thought it would be a fun video for the Xmas season.  Boy was I right!!  It was wonderfully acted and produced.  The dark characters, which are expected in this well known tale, were portrayed in a unique web of intrigue and visual magic.  Jim Carrey tends to go over the top with almost all of his characterizations.  Thankfully in this one, he finds just the right balance.  It was like seeing A Christmas Carol for the first time.  This is a video to be enjoyed by all every Xmas.
I thought this product was one of the best unexpected Xmas movies I've seen in a long time. Love it!

This new version of Dickens immortal classic "A Christmas Carol",released in Nov/09,tries to breathe new life into a venerable old tale,but unfortunately it misses the mark,sorry to say. Jim Carrey of course is the driving force/voices behind Scrooge and most of the ghosts that visit Scrooge and they have been made to facially resemble Carrey very closely. This is Zemeckis and company trying desperately to do another Polar Express,the one in which Tom Hanks did most of the voices and characters;if only this movie had had the magic that one did. Scrooge here is just a thin,withered version of Carrey. The Ghost of Christmas Past has a candle flame for a head but the face though nondescript,is still faintly Jim's,along with his unmistakable voice in an Irish brogue. The ghost of Christmas present is a huge barrel chested version of Carrey. The facial expressions of all the characters here,like many of the better animated films of recent years(Shrek for instance),are made to match the emotional moments of their particular scene,making them seem all that more real,which in turn heightens the punch.
I needn't go into the story line too much. It's the tale of Scrooge a miserly and miserable old business man who does not make merry at Christmas and despises those who do. One night he is visited by his dead partner who is there to give him a reality check and help him to straighten up and fly right before it's too late. Three visitations by spirits finally turn Scrooge around and he becomes the better human being as a result.
Director Zemeckis has used a deft touch here,following much of the original book but also trying to carve out his own little Christmas Carol niche for himself. He includes some different angles to the story like the long chase sequence with the red eyed horses and his shrinking down to Lilliputian size of Scrooge as his housekeeper sells his bed curtains and he has a tussle with a cat. I found this new stuff really detracts from the main story,as if used as an excuse to lengthen/pad the movie. I might add that I first viewed this movie in the theater in 3-D.I am so glad that the story and production values work at least as well NOT in 3-D,and were not sacrificed at the expense of hyping a new/old gimmick.
The digitally mastered picture here is beautifully crisp and clear and the breathtaking detail is phenomenal. The film is in its original a/r of 2:40:1 and this single one sided disc edition comes in a keepcase. Special features include:a look at the filming and make up process by one of its stars,a look at the making of the film and its retelling,and deleted scenes.
All in all director Zemeckis has tried and failed to do for Carrey what he did for Hanks in Polar Express. The Christmas Carol is a much beloved tale and it will continue to be so in years ahead. But there has been just too much added on in this film and it falters quite fast. Recommended...just.

I thoroughly enjoyed this interpretation of Charles Dickens story. It presented the story with the same "feeling" as the original story.  Some films try to gloss-over the seriousness of this tale...and the lesson it tries to convey.  We'll enjoy this for many holidays to come.

This is Disney's third version of this story following "Mickey's Christmas Carol" and "The Muppet's Christmas Carol". The third time's not the charm; this rendition is my all time least favorite edition of Dicken's classic.

There's a story in Ray Bradbury's "The Illustrated Man", that had authors like Egdar Allen Poe on Mars because their books were burned on earth; Dickens was there because of the ghosts in this story. The filmmakers seemed to believe that this allowed them to make this more of a horror movie than the predecessors; it managed to keep a straight PG rating, but I won't be surprised if the board considered bumping it up to PG-13.

This re-telling of the classic tale of redemption is not completely removed of redeeming qualities. Technically, the special effects of this movie are great. My wife noticed two references of people wishing Scrooge good health even though the good will was one-sided at that time. I also liked this version having Cratchett tell the postscript.

However, the story is as strong as Scrooge. Jim Carey's Scrooge comes across as creepy from scene one. And the special effects are the star here, having Scrooge shrunk to mouse size at one point and being chased by ghostly horses for a long sequence.

My favorite version is Patrick Stewart's, where the actor holds his own with the special effects in that rendition. I also think Allistair Sims' was a much superior version. In fact, the Muppets was better (I haven't seen Mickey's, but I wouldn't be surprised if I like that one better as well).

This is a true classic... and it is done very well in 3D... it's an excellent flick for watching 3d!  Jim Carey does great as Scrooge and in regard to doing the ghosts as well.  There's a lot of nice detail in this film that a lot of animated oriented 3d films do not have, unfortunately.  My wife and I have watched it time and time again... and we never grow tired of it! Bravo!

Haven't watched it. A gift for my wife.

Arrived quickly. Too new a DVD to buy used so had to pay too much for it.
A great adaptation of the classic story.  The animation is fantastic.  I like it as it is a bit more dark than other versions have been.  It is a must add to any holiday library.

I found this movie to be really creepy, not at all for small kids.  If I were a dis I would have been scared to pieces and had nightmares.  The spirits were weird and not at all like Dickens wrote.  The animation is interesting, but off putting, and although I have never been a Jim Carey fan, this is not his best or worst effort.  All in all the movie is creepy, that is the best word I can use to describe it, it made me uncomfortable.  A Christmas Carol is supposed to be about lessons leered from our mistakes, not something that sends you running away from it as fast as you can.  All of the retellings of this story in all of it's versions this is the by far the worst.

Jim Carey is excellent in this movie. He restrains his sometimes overly silly behavior. Thus, he is very believeable. The production values in this movie are true Disney quality. I'm sure we will watch this for many years to come.
I'm enjoying "A Christmas Carol" by Disney on DVD. I'm a big fan of Jim Carrey. He made a funny Scrooge.

The movie was very life-like and made the same way as Polar Express, a wonderful and moving movie [coming from a totally male reviewer].
Disney decided to keep several Christmas religious songs and music, a wise choice.

The ending, while true to the book's ending, is not like some previous movies which went beyond the book and thus were more satisfying.

Overall, though, the quality of the DVD is great; the movie is great.

It is worth watching, but TOO SCARY for small children.

NOTE: this is a re-written review.  I was too negative in the original.  Sorry.
This is a high quality featuire film animation witten with the old stle production values.  A must for any Blu-ray collection.

This movie is wonderful.  I have watched it several times and still end up with tears in my eyes.  It is scary too which really got my attention.  The graphics are great and you soon forget you aren't watching real actors.  This will now become a holiday movie I watch every year with my family.

This is by far the best 3D home movie I have to date. Of course, I only have three but that's from lack of availability, but I digress.

The animation in this movie is better than the Monsters vs Aliens or Despicable Me movies. The people look almost life like. The 3D effects bring you into the movie. As for the story, I've always been a fan and this movie does it justice. As far as a not kid friendly movie, well, it is rated PG for a reason. I won't let my 5 year old watch it for a few years.

I bought this movie thinking it would be like all the other Christmas Carol movies.  It is a great movie for adults and "mature" adolescents, but definately not for toddlers or children under the age of 5.  My daughter who loves Scooby Doo movies where there are monsters all the time, was scared to the point of shaking in my arms and we had to turn it off.  So FYI:  not the Christmas Carol you intended to purchase.

I would rate the recreation of this classic movie plot as better than average. The color and actions are good. My complain is that the 3D effect could be better. Although some some scenery render excellent 3D effect, most scenery have limited 3D depth.
We love this animated version of A Christmas Carol! Couldn't wait to make it part of our library and an every year "have to" watch!
There's no way I would let children watch this horrible version.  It ranges from just creepy scary to stupid humor.
purchased for personal use and have not had the chance to view yet...love Jim Carey so I know we will enjoy
We saw this movie when it was in the theatre, but enjoyed watching again in our Blu-Ray player. The graphics are awesome!!
I like this movie and it is a dark story but the way christmas present dies is a little heavy but its a good treatment of the story

Before I say anything else, let me get this out of the way first: If you own a 3D television and a 3D blu-ray player then BUY THIS MOVIE!!! Even if it isn't Christmas season you'll be amazed at the quality of this movie.

OK, now that my initial thoughts are out of there I must admit overall that I was very surprised with this animated take on the classic "A Christmas Carol". Everything from the presentation, special effects and animation was top-notch, even the way the story was presented. Although i'm not an aficionado of the original story I'm guessing this movie is more of a tribute to the original book by Charles Dickens. I whole heartedly expected a trivial Disney remake of the classic with the story taking the back burner while the technology of blu-ray 3D takes front-and-center. Low and behold it was anything but that; the 3D was spectacular but the performance capture animation of Ebenezer Scrooge (Jim Carey) along with the ghosts of Christmas past and present were very believable and stole the show. It is worth mentioning though that some of the secondary characters (such as Tiny Tim's family and other background filler) we're animated without performance mo-cap and it shows. This is akin to CG expressions you'll see in typical video game characters, although that might be changing (ie. compare Bethesda's "Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion" to Rockstar's latest endeavor "L.A. Noire"). Anyways the quality is superb and you'd be forgiven to think that this was an actual film and not computer animation.

The other reason I was very surprised with this movie was the way in which it was presented. Instead of going all typical-Disney on this and candy coating the characters and story, Rob Zemeckis pulled out all the stops to make this a non-stop joyride of a film. Granted you'll be treated to a slow start (give it about a half hour), but at the point where Scrooge meets up with his ghosts is when you'll be glued to the television. To me this was like a Tim Burton-esque presentation whereas the original movies would have you yawning, this rendition scares the crap out of you and has you guessing what the hell will happen next! Again, I was never a fan of the original movie but this one was a surprise that instantly had me devoted as a fan of the film and the Blu-Ray 3D format (along with "Despicable Me" as my all-time favorite 3D movie).

Overall this is a no-brainer: BUY THIS FILM. You won't regret it. Seriously, the performance mo-cap is on par with Avatar (for the main character at least) and the way that 3D is represented in this film isn't exaggerated or cliche'. This is the reason why 3D Blu-Ray was created and it's a grossly under-appreciated movie. A must buy.

I thought I would like this video. I loved it. Jim Carey did a fantastic job. Watch video all the way through the credits at the end. It takes a while but when they are over you get to see how they made this video. Unbelievable,
While I agree there are scary parts of the movie, I absolutely loved the movie and find it entertaining and true to the story.

I am half way thru, and its been OK, but I was extremely startled by the Dig at Christianity in general and preachers specifically that the Ghost of Christmas Present slips in.
To me it appears, the addition of men of the cloth"  to a lecture on hypocrisy was meant to kick Christians, pastors, priests, etc in the shins.  And on a editorial note, it definitely takes you straight out of the movie.  Which I think is just poor script writing in general - when you watch a movie you should get sucked in - not spit out.

I am not sure if I will finish it - because of that and because all the flying around made me dizzy.  I am glad I just used my credits - I had considered buying it straight out, but I wanted to see if it was any good 1st - glad i didn't get the DVD.

Anyone interested here are the relevant passages from the book and movie.

The book says this:
"`There are some upon this earth of yours,' returned the Spirit,' who lay claim to know us, and who do their deeds of passion, pride, ill-will, hatred, envy, bigotry, and selfishness in our name, who are as strange to us and all out kith and kin, as if they had never lived. Remember that, and charge their doings on themselves, not us.'  "

The movie says this:
"There are some upon this earth of yours who claim to know me and my brothers and do their deeds of ill will and selfishness in our name.  These so called men of the cloth are as strange to me and my kin as if they never lived.  Charge their doing to them, not us."

Unlike others I had seen the reviews before seeing the movie and knew it wasn't oriented toward small kids. I also saw it in the theater (in 3D) so I knew what to expect of the DVD in terms of story and the telling. I also have several versions of A Christmas Carol and don't need then all to be the same with only the actors being different. I enjoy the retelling from the classic to the Magoo to this version.

So the reason for the 1 star is for the DVD itself. I have no problems playing DVDs on my Denon DVD-2200, but the first disc I bought would stall and freeze, showing pixels. I returned it and got a replacement. That one was even worse. I've played numerous older and newer DVDs on my player before and after trying to play this DVD. They all played fine this one would not.
I had seen this  in the theater, and thoroughly enjoyed it. I just don't recommend it as a movie for children to see,just a mite bit scary.

I thoroughly enjoy "A Christmas Carol" by Dickens and have read it a number of times. Like all movies, this one took some creative license in its making. Despite what others have said, there are a number of segments from the Dicken's story left out. There is also a relatively long "chase" scene involving the ghost of Christmas future that I found...boring...and misplaced. Really? Scrooge shrinking to the size of a mouse? Other than that, the movie is in the GOOD category... not GREAT... good... not as good as TBS's "A Christmas Carol" with Patrick Stewart; and certainly not as great as the 1951 version with Alistair Sim... It is animated, and there are advantages with that as far as special effects go, otherwise, it's a keeper and worth watching again.

I will make this short and sweet:
1. The animation was wonderful - very cool to watch.
2. It was WAY too scary for a PG rated movie. I have 3 kids ranging from 9 to 3  years old and they were all terrified & covering their eyes AND ears. As soon as they uncovered them, another scary scene came along. It was one scary scene after another. They were too scared to watch most of the movie.
3. The characters use 1800s english, with accents, which was very difficult for my kids to understand. They kept asking me what they were talking about.
4. Overall, I think it was a pretty good movie, but it just wasn't made for little kids. I think it's appropriate for kids ages 10 & up. I'm giving it three stars because I feel that it was marketed to little kids, and was not appropriate. I would not have rented it had I known how scary it was.

It is hard to find a movie, classic or otherwise that follows the original book/script. The artwork and characterization was stunning. I always look forward to the Seasons Messages through this dynamic story, it truely sets the mood for the rest of the year. It all comes together, the scenery, music and message with modern day technology. I was apprehensive when I first heard it came out, now I want to enjoy it all year long.

Actually that quote is from "How The Grinch Stole Christmas", but can somehow describe the audio factor to this great looking movie by the makers of The Polar Express. There are alot of familiar dialogue to this well story known to all in civilization, but there are also many adjustments for the 3D generation in regards to action and fantasy. Alot of action sequences have absolutely nothing to do with the true story of Ebenezer calamity in adjusting to his new found life as a mortal redeemed in spirit by three wise ghosts who challange him not to change in light of what they have shown him. The overabundance of laughter from the ghost of Christmas present establishes the fact that only Jim Carrey could have pulled that one off without sounding tired of laughing at the end of it.
The visual trickery of floating in the room's feast peering outward below to the world as if inside a giant balloon is very effective, and a neat little gimmick, accompanied by familiar Christmas anthem.
The only trouble I had with taking Mr. Scrooge seriously as a changed man was I had a feeling he was simply an old crone who was out saving his skin from damnation, and not entirely enthused or having overcome his stupid notions of what life had become to mean to him.
In prior roles, for example, I have seen Scrooge actually look repentant, not only to save his skin, but actually wanting to become apart of civilization of which he thought he lost, and was once beside himself to regain it, and for whatever reason he could think of to do it. The ghosts themselves presented him with life of yesterday he had hold dear, the times of today with which he is apart of, and the sights of tomorrow of which he still has some control of if he decides to change his ways.
It is these ingrediants that overcome his cold spirit in a matter of a few hours, but the Scrooge presented here doesnt seem to change until he becomes frighted out of his bleak skull by falling from the heavens down to earth by himself, or grasping at the edges of his rocking tombstone eventually falling once again into the bowls of hell. These are the things that have changed this particular Scrooge, not because he has reattached his soul for the better, but rather to find a way to avoid unpleasant results by finding a way to behave from the bitter soul he once was. Never does he shed a tear, of which Scrooge most certainly did so before he became a changed man to the world. And for all the fantastic 3D visuals, this Scrooge remains cold, even in the final sequence.
And the three ghosts are the most forgettable ghosts to date, even with the elaborate effects. Strange how that worked out.

What would Christmas be without a visit to Charles Dickens' 'A Christmas Carol', a story that dates back to 1843 and has been loved and read every year at this time?  There have been other films, stage productions, musicals, and family readings galore and it still holds the magic of what the spirit of Christmas is all about.  Doubtless there will be flocks of naysayers who don't buy into this adaptation by Robert Zemekis, but given the ghost story magic Dickens' created, this film takes it one step further and makes the ghostly three spirits very much alive and beautiful fanciful.

Combining the actors with animation (animating the actors might be a better way of describing the magic) makes each of the many very well known actors who portray the characters that much more credible.  Jim Carrey is at his peak as an actor in his ability to become the illusions his mind creates: he portrays all three ghosts as well a Scrooge at every level of his history.  Other actors who are transformed by Zemekis and staff include Gary Oldman as the trio of Cratchit, Marley's Ghost, and Tiny Tim, Colin Firth as the jovial nephew, Cary Elwes, Robin Wright Penn, Bob Hoskins, Fionnula Flanagan and a host of others.  The costumes and scenery are brilliantly executed.

One problem with the film that may require parental judgment is the fact that the ghosts are truly scary and children might not be able to get past the fear they instill.  But they will grow into the film as it is likely a work that will be resurrected every Christmas season as a tradition.  It is 'excellent, my good fellows'.  Grady Harp, December 10
we all know the classic "A Christmas Carol"..this is wonderful because of the great disney animation.  Worth buying just to watch every year..kids/adults both really enjoyed!

Loved this movie in keeping with the holiday spirit!...It was visually and audibly stunning!!....Jim Carrey and the rest of the cast did an amazing job with the motion capture technology. This will be shown annually (Christmas-time) in my house!

This is a truly disappointing DVD. The writers left out a lot of dialogue for visual effects. They were more interested in created a visual version that is full of action. Much of the action has nothing to do with the storyline. The scenes are dark, hard to watch, and change very rapidly. The characters are cartoonish, poorly created and for CGI creations do not have much humanlike action.  If I had previewed this DVD, I would NOT have purchased it. I even waited for the Blue ray version before making my purchase. I am sending this to my grandchildren. I am sure they will enjoy it more than I do. Best advice: Try to watch it before you buy it. If you like it fine. I didn't.

I find this version of Charles Dickens A Christmas Carol not for children, but for the older viewer (e.g. sixteen or older).  Why?  Because the "Disney" name is miss-leading.  Understand me correctly!  I find that Disney actually hit on the metaphysical/theological level giving a quite frank appearance to the wasting away of the spirit of Christmas present, for which a applaud them!  Bravo for not "sugar coating" what lies ahead for us all!!!  I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and I am glad to have purchased it; however, I would not show it to the typical Disney age viewer!  4 stars...I hope all whom view this movie are changed for the better!
I enjoyed this movie from begining to end.  Usually I fall assleep while watching an animated movie.  I was awake for the entire move.
My granddaughter and I loved this Jim Carey movie.  She is nine and her school just did the Christmas Carol play so she knew what was going to happen.  Would recommend especially this time of year

We were excited to watch a Christmas movie of a classic story, but this was not at all what we were expecting. It has some very scary and disturbing scenes for kids so let me be quite clear THIS IS NOT A CHILDREN'S MOVIE!!! There are much better versions of movies for this great story. This has nothing to do with the quality of the movie, just the content. I really don't like writing bad reviews, but this was sadly disappointing.

Terrible Terrible ...Although I did read reviews that were good and bad I decided to go ahead and make my own judgement. Bad choice on my part should have went with the bad .I don't have small children but can see where parents would  be upset that do .Great animation cannot dispute that ..Annoying and bothersome are two words that best some it up for me .Walt Disney would surely be disappointed !!

I've just watched this movie for the first time. The only thing that was wrong with this movie is that it was REALLY scary in some parts.  Also I regret not seeing it in the theater while it was showing in 3D.  I can tell that it was made for a 3D audience and I feel like I missed out on that part of the movie.  Other than that it's exactly as I remember all the other versions of it.  It's a must see film for the whole family. (As long as the kids are over 10.)

My 10 year old son and I sat down to watch this movie . . . we were so disappointed.  First, there are scenes in this movie I wish my 10 year old hadn't seen.  (Watching the "Ghost of Christmas Present" turn to ash and bones isn't a delightful Christmas experience, for example.)  Second, Jim Carrey . . . he is typically awesome.  Apparently, they didn't let him make the part his own.  Scrooge stunk in the movie.  Finally, the animation falls FAR short of what one normally expects from Disney.  My opinion: save your money . . . I, and my son, absolutely hated this one.

Great holiday film for the whole family. Superlative animation and special effects. The classic story may be an old one, but it will always be the best and most beloved tale for many decades to come. There was nothing I needed to know before I purchased this DVD, I love the Dickens tale, and this version of it is fantastic!.

I was surprised to hear good Christmas music in this movie that lifted my spirits and put me in the Christmas mood. I also liked them not deleting the Lord out of the Movie. It's nice to see that in a Disney movie. Most of your Disney Christmas movies never mention God. I'll give them credit for this one and also the Muppet Christmas movie a few years ago. By the way; ever go to a Disney park during Christmas time? No mention of the Lord Jesus or even a manger. Back then there was no room at the inn for Jesus. Nothings changed these days; no room at Disneyland for Jesus either. At least, I never saw anything related to Jesus, while I was there Christmas. The computer animation and camera movements, in the movie, were superb. The Christmas Carol was worth this blue ray combo price. Wall-mart wasn't that much cheaper on this one.
when i received my shipment it looked as if the dvd was under a stack of textbooks. the case is bent in and not in fair condition whatsoever. no long doing business with this seller.

I bought this for the 3D and I was pleasently surprised! I have the "other" animated 3D movies and they utterly pale in comparison to the 3D here. I only watched the 2nd chapter and that was more than enough for me to get an idea of what I could expect.

As far as 3D animated movies go, there is nothing better. At least not now! Well done Disney. Well done!...

My kids barely understood what was being said which is sad because I think they miss the moral of the story, The second ghost was a little too much I watching his life thru the floor REALLY! I believe my daughter smacked her lips a few times before she got up and left, I must say the last ghost was a treat we were intrigued at that point we were like whats going to happen next and all the scenes before this was WASTE OF MY FAMILY TIME!! So in closing from the beginning of the last ghost to the credits was worth watching!!

Jim Carey sometimes goes over the top in his movies.  This time he stopped just at the edge.  I was suprised when the "how it wa made" showed the real Carey doing the acting for the movie.  Kudos to Careyand the movie.

A wonderfully depicted retelling of the Dickens' classic!  The way they can animate the real actors is amazing.  While it was too "old" for my 3 1/2 year old grandson to enjoy, I loved it!  Hopefully he will grow to appreciate it when he is a little older.  The entire cast & crew hit this one out of the park!
This is one of the better 3D videos we have purchased. The 3D graphics, really come out of the TV. Truly an enjoyable experience!

This is the best version of "A Christmas Carol" that I believe I have ever seen.  Colorful, brilliant, and mesmerizing, this one will surely be an instant classic, and must for your holiday DVD collection.

This movie is a delightful re-telling of Dickens' CHRISTMAS CAROL.  It is fun and easy for your younger family members and totally enjoyable for those older family members who are acquainted with the Dickens classic used for the story.  Watching this movie as a family will be time well spent.
I loved this movie alot. I would recommend this movie to people I know and to people I don't know. Jim Carey was great as usual.

Director Robert Zemeckis (The Polar Express, Forrest Gump) has scored again with this excellent animated version of Charles Dickens' classic holiday tale.  Jim Carrey stars as Ebenezer Scrooge, a crotchety old man who cares nothing about others or the holiday season.  He prefers to spend his time alone in his office or home, sitting in front of the fire.  He also belittles his employee Bob Cratchit (Gary Oldman), despite his young son's illness.

On one such evening, Scrooge is in his customary place in front of the fireplace when a ghostly spirit visits him.  The spirit informs Scrooge that he is the Ghost of Christmas Past, and he takes Scrooge on a journey to the Christmases he had as a child and young man.  Scrooge sees where he went to school, and the holiday ball he attended with a girl that later became his wife.  The marriage ended in divorce.  Another spirit, The Ghost of Christmas Present, shows Scrooge the events of the current holiday, including the Cratchit family toasting him for his supplying Bob with a job.  Finally, the Ghost of Christmas Future shows Scrooge close to death, and the town members are rejoicing his passing.  Also, the Cratchits mourn the loss of Tiny Tim.

All of these spirits have a profound effect on Scrooge himself.  Soon, he's singing carols in the street, skating behind carriages, and asking people for forgiveness for the way he treated them in the past.  No one is more surprised at Scrooge's miraculous transformation than Bob Cratchit.

This is an excellent movie.  I've been a Zemeckis fan for years, and my family and I watch "The Polar Express" every Christmas season.  I'm sure "A Christmas Carol" will become regular holiday viewing for us, too.  The special effects in the film are astounding, and the story contains a fine moral lesson to be learned.  Make "A Christmas Carol" part of your regular holiday viewing.  Your family will love it.  Highly recommended.

There are a handful of complaints about this movie and to a certain degree I may agree. It is not really a movie for the young as it is pretty scary at times.
But the 3D version is done beautifully. You could almost feel the snow hitting your face. It is very dark visually (at least on my 65" Mitsubishi DLP TV played on the excellent Panasonic DMP-BDT350 blu-ray player).
With not too many 3D movies available right now, this to me is a showcase video for a 3D system. My wife and I enjoyed it very much. It will become a holiday classic.

The animation and character design were a mixed bag at best, and seem to be a step back from BEOWULF, Zemekis' last Mo-Cap feature. Backgrounds are beautifully rendered, but the figures are very stiff, and many are oddly proportioned, existing in a weird gray area between realistic and cartoon anatomy.

Note to the "too scary for kids" crowd - IT'S A GHOST STORY - read the source. The movie got that mostly right.

As someone who is a great fan of Dickens' story and was really looking forward to this adaptation, it was a huge disappointment.

This is the worst version I have ever seen!!!  The fist two ghosts were silly and totally out of character.  And what did the sequence where Scrooge is shrunk add to the story at all? Please don't waste your money or your time.
I saw it in the theater in 3d. I have a high def flat screen tv and I don't need 3d. The movie was awesome.
Fantastic movie.  To see is to be believed. Well worth the cost and our kids aswell as ourselves find it very entertaining.  A fantastic Christmas movie that will be enjoyed all year round!

I am not a fan of Jim Carey, but I love the story, A Christmas Carol. My family also likes the Pixel movies, however, this movie is a real disappointment.  Parts of it are o.k. but some parts are dark and eerie.  I know the ghosts are supposed to put fear in Ebeneezer's heart, but this was somewhat overkill. Jim Carey is still recognizable in spite of his portrayal of Scrooge, but I could overlook that had the movie been any good.  Love Disney, but this one fell a little short, in my opinion.
Overall, the revision is pretty good but is slow in certain areas (probably much like the original).  You would't know it was Jim Carrey because it doesn't sound like him.
